Welcome to BMI203HW1’s documentation!¶

class align.algs.PairwiseAligner(scoring_mat)¶

Bases: object

Parent class for align.algs.SmithWaterman and align.algs.NeedlemanWunsch that contains shared alignment functions and variables

Parameters

  • gapB_mat (np.ndarray) – Matrix to keep track of scores for adding gaps to seqB

  • back (np.ndarray) – Matrix that keeps track of pointers for backtracking through match matrix

  • back_A (np.ndarray) – Matrix that keeps track of pointers for backtracking through gap A matrix

  • back_B (np.ndarray) – Matrix that keeps track of pointers for backtracking through gap B matrix

  • opt_score (int) – Variable to keep track of final alignment score

  • seqA (str) – Query sequence A

  • seqB (str) – Query sequence B

  • seqA_align (str) – Aligned version of query sequence A

  • seqB_align (str) – Aligned version of query sequence B

  • D_open (int) – Opening gap penalty

  • D_extend (int) – Extension gap penalty

read_scoring_file(scores_file)¶

Reads in file containing scoring matrix

Parameters

scores_file (str) – Pathlike string to .mat file with substitution matrix

Returns

tuple containing n x n substitution matrix and a list of n amino acids

init_scoring_dict(scoring_mat=None, alphabet=None)¶

Read in scoring file and creating dictionary

Parameters

  • scoring_mat (np.ndarray) – n x n substitution matrix

  • alphabet (list) – list of n amino acids

Returns

dictionary that maps tuple of amino acid (aa1, aa2) to score

clean_sequence(seq, remove_unknown=False)¶

Makes sequence uppercase and replaces unknown characters with * (or removes them if remove_unknown=True)

Parameters

  • seq (str) – sequence to clean

  • remove_unknown (bool, default=False) – Whether to replace or remove unknown characters in query sequence

Returns

cleaned sequence with all uppercase letters

align(seqA, seqB, sw=False)¶

Populates scoring and backtracing matrices with alignment scores and pointers

Parameters

  • seqA (str) – First query sequence

  • seqB (str) – Second query sequence

  • sw (bool, default = False) – whether to perform Smith-Waterman alignment (default, values clipped to 0)

backtrace(i, j, curr_back)¶

Backtracking steps shared by SW and NW algorithms

Parameters

  • i (int) – current row value

  • j (int) – current col value

  • curr_back (np.ndarray) – current pointer matrix to consider

Returns

tuple (i, j) containing updated row and column values

class align.algs.NeedlemanWunsch(scoring_mat)¶

Bases: align.algs.PairwiseAligner

Needleman-Wunsch global alignment algorithm

align(seqA, seqB, score_only=False)¶

Perform Needleman-Wunch global alignment with affine gap scoring. Initializes matrices and calls parent align method for scoring

Parameters

  • seqA (str) – First query sequence

  • seqB – Second query sequence

  • score_only (bool, default=False) – Whether to return the aligned sequences with the score (default) or just the score

Returns

Gapped version of seqA, gapped version of seqB, alignment score; if score_only = True is passed, only the alignment score is returned

backtrace(score_only=False)¶

Backtracing through scoring matrices using parameters for Needleman-Wunch global alignment parameters

Parameters

score_only (bool, default=False) – Whether to return the aligned sequences with the score (default) or just the score

Returns

Gapped version of seqA, gapped version of seqB, alignment score; if score_only = True is passed, only the alignment score is returned

class align.algs.SmithWaterman(scoring_mat)¶

Bases: align.algs.PairwiseAligner

Smith-Waterman local alignment algorithm

align(seqA, seqB, score_only=False)¶

Perform Smith-Waterman local alignment with affine gap scoring. Initializes matrices and calls parent align method for scoring

Parameters

  • seqA (str) – First query sequence

  • seqB – Second query sequence

  • score_only (bool, default=False) – Whether to return the aligned sequences with the score (default) or just the score

Returns

Gapped version of seqA, gapped version of seqB, alignment score; if score_only = True is passed, only the alignment score is returned

backtrace(score_only=False)¶

Backtracing through scoring matrices using parameters for Smith-Waterman local alignment parameters

Parameters

score_only (bool, default=False) – Whether to return the aligned sequences with the score (default) or just the score

Returns

Gapped version of seqA, gapped version of seqB, alignment score; if score_only = True is passed, only the alignment score is returned

align.algs.read_fasta(input_file)¶

Parses fasta file to retrieve fasta sequence

Parameters

input_file (str) – Path to fasta file

Returns

Gapped version of seqA, gapped version of seqB, alignment score; if score_only = True is passed, only the alignment score is returned
